title: Olly Alexander and Keeley Hawes kick off filming on Russell T Davies drama Boys
text:
Keely Hawes and Olly Alexander filming in Manchester (Picture: Paul Cousans/Zenpix)

Olly Alexander and Keeley Hawes have been pictured as filming gets underway on new drama Boys from writer Russell T Davies.

The new five-part Channel 4 drama will follow the joy and heartbreak of four friends growing up in the 1980s, as the rise of AIDS tests their lives more than ever before.

Filming on the series kicked off in Manchester on Tuesday (15 October), with Olly sporting all the denim he can possibly find.

The 29-year-old singer, primarily known as the frontman of Years & Years, plays 18-year-old Ritchie Tozer in the series, who is described as the family’s ‘golden boy’ despite keeping secrets from them.

Olly needs some more denim, stat (Picture: Paul Cousans/Zenpix)

Keeley will play Ritchie’s mum Valerie, with the supporting cast including Neil Patrick Harris, Stephen Fry, Shaun Dooley and Tracy Ann Oberman.

An official synopsis for the show reads: ‘It’s 1981, the start of a new decade and Ritchie, Roscoe and Colin begin a new life in London. Strangers at first, these young gay lads, and their best friend Jill, find themselves thrown together, and soon share each other’s adventures.

‘But a new virus is on the rise, and soon their lives will be tested in ways they never imagined. As the decade passes, and they grow up in the shadow of AIDS, they’re determined to live and love more fiercely than ever.’

Keeley Hawes filming on the new series (Picture: Paul Cousans/Zenpix)

The new series is set in the 1980s (Picture: Paul Cousans/Zenpix)

Speaking about the show, Olly said: ‘I feel like the luckiest boy in the world to be a part of this project, I’ve been a fan of Russell T Davies ever since I watched Queer As Folk in secret at 14-years-old.

‘His work helped shape my identity as a gay person so I’m absolutely over the moon we’ll be working together. The script was amazing to read, I laughed and I cried a lot, it’s a privilege to be helping to tell this story and I’m so excited.’

Filming is underway in Manchester (Picture: Paul Cousans/Zenpix)

If you’re unfamiliar, Russell’s past writing credits include Queer As Folk, Years And Years, A Very English Scandal, and Cucumber, so it’s certainly set to be a future highlight.

Boys will air on Channel 4 in 2020.
